conclusion: Analyze the given U-I graph and use the information provided by lines a and b to determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell.
Line a intersects the U-axis at U = 5 V.
The open circuit voltage Voc = 5 V.
Line a intersects the I-axis at I = 0.4 A.
The short circuit current Isc = 0.4 A.
Line b represents the U-I relationship of the load resistance R.
Using the points (0, 0) and (0.3, 3.6) on line b.
The slope of line b = 12 Ω.
The internal resistance r can be found using the relationship between the open circuit voltage, short circuit current, and the load resistance.
The internal resistance r is given by r = Voc/Isc - R.
Substituting the known values: r = 12.5 Ω - 12 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity is 0.5 Ω.
